diskovery moduleÂ¶

The diskovery module is the primary module that acts as a wrapper around the functionality of the other DisKovery submodules. It stores dictionaries that handle the memory management of assets and objects to be used in the scene, including:

  • Mesh objects for 3D models
  • Texture objects for external images
  • Shader objects for GLSL shader programs
  • Pipeline objects (associated with Shader objects)
  • VkDescriptorSetLayout objects (associated with Shader objects)
  • VkSampler objects (for sampling Texture objects)

In addition to managing assets, it stores objects of a few other classes:

  • A DkInstance that is used by all DisKovery objects that interface with Vulkan
  • A EntityManager that stores all Entity objects in the scene

The diskovery module also holds the definitions for the three basic entity types, from which DisKovery users can extend their own custom object definitions:

  • Entity - a basic Entity that has a position in the 3D world
  • RenderedEntity - an Entity with a Mesh that is rendered to the scene
  • AnimatedEntity - a RenderedEntity with an Animator to handle skeletal animation
class diskovery.Entity(position=None)Â¶

Bases: object

The Entity class is the simplest object that can be added to the game world. An Entity exists in 3D space, but will not have any visual representation in the game world.

Multiple default extensions of the Entity class are included in DisKovery, namely: - Light for handling the lighting of a scene - Camera for setting the view of the scene

Attributes of the Entity class:

positionÂ¶

The position of the Entity as a 3D vector, stored as a tuple. Stores the value of diskovery.Entity.position if one was provided.

parentÂ¶

A reference to another Entity that, when not set to None, gives a parent position from which the position of this Entity is translated so that the position of this Entity is relative to its parent

childrenÂ¶

A list of references to other Entity objects, for use as described in the parent attributeâs description.

Methods of the Entity class:

detach()Â¶

Removes the reference to the parent of the Entity cleanly

set_parent(parent)Â¶

Sets the parent of the Entity to be the given Entity

Parameters:parent â the Entity to set the parent as
world_position()Â¶

Get the position of the Entity relative to world coordinates rather than the default, which is relative to its parentâs coordinates

Returns:a tuple describing the x, y, and z coordinates of the Entity in world space
class diskovery.RenderedEntity(position=None, rotation=None, scale=None, shade=None, textures=None, mesh=None)Â¶

Bases: diskovery.Entity

Extends Entity to include references to the necessary objects to present an object on the screen. All parameters are optional, as default values for each are either preloaded into the environment or simple tuples:

parameter default value
position (0, 0, 0)
rotation (0, 0, 0)
scale (1, 1, 1)
shade âDefaultâ
textures [âDefaultâ]
mesh âDefaultâ

Attributes of the RenderedEntity class:

rotationÂ¶

The rotation of the RenderedEntity as a set of Euler angles, stored as a tuple.

scaleÂ¶

The x, y, and z scale of the RenderedEntity, stored as a tuple

texturesÂ¶

A list of strings containing keys to the dictionary of Texture objects stored in this module

meshÂ¶

A string containing a key to the dictionary of Mesh objects stored in this module

definitionÂ¶

A tuple of BindingType s that is used to determine which VkDescriptorSetLayout is needed. Taken from the Shader given by the shade argument, or the default shader if no value is given.

uniformsÂ¶

A list of UniformBuffer objects filled by iterating over the list of UniformType s stored in the Shader object

descriptorÂ¶

A Descriptor defined by the definition described above, the VkDescriptorSetLayout associated with that definition (in this moduleâs dictionary of descriptor set layouts, using the definition tuple as a key)

cleanup()Â¶

Handles necessary Destroy methods for all the Vulkan components contained inside the RenderedEntity

get_mesh()Â¶

References the dictionary of meshes in this module to retrieve this RenderedEntityâs mesh

Returns:The Mesh with this RenderedEntityâs key
get_pipeline()Â¶

References the dictionary of pipelines in this module to retrieve this RenderedEntityâs pipeline

Returns:The Pipeline with this RenderedEntityâs definition
get_texture(index)Â¶

References the dictionary of textures in this module to retrieve this RenderedEntityâs texture at a given index in its list of textures

Parameters:index â The index in the list of textures to reference when retrieving a texture
Returns:The Texture with the key at the given index of this RenderedEntityâs key list
update(ind)Â¶

Updates every UniformBuffer stored in uniforms with new data

Parameters:ind â the index indicating which Buffer in each UniformBuffer should be filled with new data
diskovery.add_entity(entity, name)Â¶

Adds an entity to the EntityManager stored in this module.

More details can be found in the add_entity() method.

Parameters:
  • entity â The Entity to add
  • name â A given name to be used as the key for the entity in the EntityManager
diskovery.add_mesh(filename, name=None)Â¶

Creates and adds a Mesh to the dictionary of Meshes stored in this module. Has some basic wrapping to ensure keys are not duplicated and the filename provided links to a valid 3D object data file.

Parameters:
  • filename â A str of the name of a file stored locally that contains 3D object data (either .obj or .dae format)
  • name â A given name for the newly created mesh. If not defined, the filename without its extension will be the key used in the dictionary
diskovery.add_shader(name, files, definition, uniforms)Â¶

Creates and adds a Shader to the dictionary of Shaders stored in this module. Also creates a Pipeline and VkDescriptorSetLayout based on the definition given and adds them to their respective dictionaries.

Parameters:
  • name â A given name for the newly created shader
  • files â A list containing the filenames of all stages of the shader (for now, just vertex and fragment shaders)
  • definition â A tuple of BindingType objects that reflect the bindings used in the shader
  • uniforms â A list of UniformType objects that reflect the content of each of the above bindings that binds a uniform
diskovery.add_texture(filename, name=None)Â¶

Creates and adds a Texture to the dictionary of Textures stored in this module. Has some basic wrapping to ensure keys are not duplicated and the filename provided links to a valid image file.

Parameters:
  • filename â A str of the name of a file stored locally that contains image data (all common formats accepted)
  • name â A given name for the newly created texture. If not defined, the filename without its extension will be the key used in the dictionary
diskovery.descriptor(definition)Â¶

Retrieve a VkDescriptorSetLayout from the dictionary in this module

Parameters:definition â The definition (key) of the VkDescriptorSetLayout
diskovery.init(debug_mode=False)Â¶

Initializes the DkInstance and EntityManager objects used in this module.

Parameters:debug_mode â Whether or not the DkInstance should be created with Vulkan Validation Layers
diskovery.mesh(name)Â¶

Retrieve a Mesh from the dictionary in this module

Parameters:name â The name (key) of the Mesh
diskovery.pipeline(definition)Â¶

Retrieve a Pipeline from the dictionary in this module

Parameters:name â The definition (key) of the Pipeline
diskovery.quit()Â¶

Handles necessary Vulkan Destroy methods for all Vulkan components

diskovery.run()Â¶

Begins the game loop and starts the event handler

diskovery.shader(name)Â¶

Retrieve a Shader from the dictionary in this module

Parameters:name â The name (key) of the Shader
diskovery.texture(name)Â¶

Retrieve a Texture from the dictionary in this module

Parameters:name â The name (key) of the Texture
